question: Which one of the following governmental steps has proved relatively effective in controlling the double-digit rate of inflation in the Indian economy during recent years?
option1: Enhanced rate of production of all consumer goods
option4: Containing budgetary deficits and unproductive expenditure
answer: Containing budgetary deficits and unproductive expenditure
explanation: Budgetary deficit is the difference between all receipts and expenses in both revenue and capital account of the government. Similarly, if the capital disbursements of the government exceed capital receipts, it leads to capital account deficit. Budgetary deficit is usually expressed as a percentage of GDP.
